info.title: Twine API
info.description:
# Overview
The Twine Health API is RESTful API. The requests and responses are formated according to the [JSON API](http://jsonapi.org/format/1.0/) specification.

In addition to this documentation, we also provide an [OpenAPI](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/2.0.md) "yaml" file describing the API: [Twine API Specification](swagger.yaml).

# Authentication
Authentication for the Twine API is based on the [OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749). Twine currently supports grant types of **client_credentials** and **refresh_token**.

See [POST /oauth/token](#operation/createToken) for details on the request and response formats.
<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

twine_auth.description:
Get access to data while protecting your account credentials.
OAuth2 is also a safer and more secure way to give you access.

scopes.group: access patients and data within a group
scopes.organization: access patients and data within an organization

tags.name: oauth
tags.description: Authentication operations

tags.name: organization
tags.description: An organization is a Twine customer. No data is accessible across organizations.

tags.name: group
tags.description: A group is a cohort of patients within an organization. The creation of groups allows for the segmentation of dashboards and analytics. For example, a group might correspond to the patients in a particular practice or the employees of a particular employer.

tags.name: coach
tags.description: A coach is a person that supports a patient

tags.name: reward program
tags.description: A reward program provides the details for a rewards program for a group. Different rewards programs can be created for different periods of time specified by the start_at and end_at dates. A reward program can activated for a patient any time between these dates. An activated reward program for a patient is called a reward program activation.

tags.name: action
tags.description: An action is an actionable item in a patient's plan.

tags.name: bundle
tags.description: A bundle is a collection of actions (an action plan) in a patient's plan summary.

tags.name: calendar event
tags.description: A calendar event represents an event involving or relevant to a patient which will or has occurred on a specific date or during a specific period of time.

tags.name: email history
tags.description: Email history represents a single email that was sent using twine.

tags.name: health profile
tags.description: A health profile contains a set of health questions and answers for a patient.

tags.name: health profile answer
tags.description: A health profile answer is the answer to a question for a patient.

tags.name: health profile question
tags.description: A health profile question contains a health question and the corresponding answer for a patient.

tags.name: health question definition
tags.description: A health question definition specifies a health question and the corresponding answer choices.

tags.name: metric
tags.description: A metric is a quantitative result for a patient. For example, vital signs, lab results, etc. are all metrics.

tags.name: patient
tags.description: A patient is the core user of Twine.

tags.name: plan
tags.description: A plan is the set of actions and associated goals for a patient.

tags.name: reward
tags.description: A reward allocates a portion of the budget from the reward program activation for achieving a particular goal and sets a target date.

tags.name: reward earning
tags.description: A reward earning specifies the portion of a reward that was earned and at what date.

tags.name: reward earning fulfillment
tags.description: A reward earning fulfillment specifies the portion of a reward earning that was fulfilled and at what date.

tags.name: reward program activation
tags.description: A reward program activation is the activation of a reward program for a specific patient.

post.description:
Create an OAuth 2.0 Bearer token. A valid bearer token is required for all other API requests.

Be sure to set the header `Content-Type: "application/vnd.api+json"`. Otherwise, you will get an error
403 Forbidden. Using `Content-Type: "application/json"` is permitted (to support older oauth clients) but when
using `application/json` the body should have a body in the following format instead of nesting under
`data.attributes`:
```
{
  "grant_type": "client_credentials",
  "client_id": "95c78ab2-167f-40b8-8bec-8398d4b87454",
  "client_secret": "35d18dc9-a3dd-4948-b787-063a490b9354"
}
```

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: List of related resources to include in the response

get.description: Get the list of groups a token can be used to access.

post.description: Create a calendar event for a patient. Attribute `all_day` must be set to `true` and `end_at` cannot be set for `plan-check-in` event type.

get.description: Get a list of calendar events

parameters.name: filter[patient]
parameters.description: Patient id to fetch calendar event. Note that one of the following filters must be specified: `filter[patient]`, `filter[group]`, `filter[organization]`, or `filter[attendees]`.

parameters.name: filter[groups]
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of group ids. Note that one of the following filters must be specified: `filter[patient]`, `filter[group]`, `filter[organization]`, or `filter[attendees]`.

parameters.name: filter[organization]
parameters.description: Twine organization id. Note that one of the following filters must be specified: `filter[patient]`, `filter[group]`, `filter[organization]`, or `filter[attendees]`.

parameters.name: filter[attendees]
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of coach or patient ids. Note that one of the following filters must be specified: `filter[patient]`, `filter[group]`, `filter[organization]`, or `filter[attendees]`.

parameters.name: filter[completed]
parameters.description: If not specified, return all calendar events. If set to `true` return only events marked as completed, if set to `false`, return only events not marked as completed yet.

parameters.name: filter[start_at]
parameters.description: The start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) dates are ISO date and time strings separated by `..`. Example for events starting in November 2017 (America/New_York): `filter[start_at]=2017-11-01T00:00:00-04:00..2017-12-01T00:00:00-05:00`

parameters.name: filter[end_at]
parameters.description: The start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) dates are ISO date and time strings separated by `..`. Example for events ending in November 2017 (America/New_York): `filter[end_at]=2017-11-01T00:00:00-04:00..2017-12-01T00:00:00-05:00`

parameters.name: filter[completed_at]
parameters.description: The start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) dates are ISO date and time strings separated by `..`. Example for events completed in November 2017 (America/New_York): `filter[completed_at]=2017-11-01T00:00:00-04:00..2017-12-01T00:00:00-05:00`

parameters.name: filter[created_at]
parameters.description: The start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) dates are ISO date and time strings separated by `..`. Example for events created in November 2017 (America/New_York): `filter[created_at]=2017-11-01T00:00:00-04:00..2017-12-01T00:00:00-05:00`

parameters.name: filter[updated_at]
parameters.description: The start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) dates are ISO date and time strings separated by `..`. Example for events updated in November 2017 (America/New_York): `filter[updated_at]=2017-11-01T00:00:00-04:00..2017-12-01T00:00:00-05:00`

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: List of related resources to include in the response

get.description: Get a calendar event by id

patch.description: Update a calendar event for a patient. Attribute `all_day` must be true and `end_at` cannot be specified for `plan-check-in` event type. To mark a calendar event as 'completed', set `completed_at` and `completed_by` to desired values.  To mark a completed calendar event as 'not completed', set `completed_at` and `completed_by` to `null`.

delete.description: Delete a calendar event by id

get.description: Get a list of email histories

parameters.name: filter[receiver]
parameters.description: Twine user id of email recipient. Required if filter[sender] is not defined.

parameters.name: filter[sender]
parameters.description: Twine user id of email sender. Required if filter[receiver] is not defined.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
valid sorts:
  * send_time - ascending by send_time
  * -send_time - descending by send_time

get.description: Get the plan summary for a patient.
Get a list of patients.

parameters.name: filter[groups]
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of group ids. Note that either `filter[group]` or `filter[organization]` must be specified.

parameters.name: filter[organization]
parameters.description: Twine organization id. Note that either `filter[group]` or `filter[organization]` must be specified.

parameters.name: filter[archived]
parameters.description: If not specified, return all patients. If set to 'true' return only archived patients, if set to 'false', return only patients who are not archived.

parameters.name: filter[created_at]
parameters.description: The start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) dates are ISO date and time strings separated by `..`. Example for patients created in November 2017 (America/New_York): `filter[created_at]=2017-11-01T00:00:00-04:00..2017-12-01T00:00:00-05:00`

parameters.name: filter[updated_at]
parameters.description: The start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) dates are ISO date and time strings separated by `..`. Example for patients updated in November 2017 (America/New_York): `filter[updated_at]=2017-11-01T00:00:00-04:00..2017-12-01T00:00:00-05:00`

post.description: Create a reward for a patient.

get.description: Get a list of rewards matching the specified filters.
Get a reward record by id.

post.description: Create a reward earning for a reward. There can only be one earning for a reward. It is possilble to create multiple reward earnings simultaneously by providing and array of reward earnings in the data property.

get.description: Get a list of reward earnings matching the specified filters.

parameters.name: filter[ready_for_fulfillment]
parameters.description: If true, only returns those reward earnings for which ready_for_fulfillment is true and fulfilled_at is null. If false, only returns those reward earnings for which ready_for_fulfillment is false and fulfilled_at is null.

get.description: Get a reward earning record by id.

post.description: Create a reward earning fulfillment for a reward earning. There can only be one fulfillment for each earning.

get.description: Get a list of reward earning fulfillments matching the specified filters.
Get a reward earning fulfillment record by id.

post.description: Create a reward program activation for a patient. There can only be one activation for a patient for a given reward program.

get.description: Get a list of reward program activations matching the specified filters.
Get a reward program activationrecord by id.

errors.detail: A valid bearer token is required
A valid bearer token is required

client_id.description: Contact Twine to get a client id and secret.

client_secret.description: Contact Twine to get a client id and secret. Secret is required if grant_type is "client_credentials"

tagline.description: Tagline of the reward program - designed to be one line

description.description: Description of the reward program - designed to be a comprehensive text description

start_at.description: Date at which the reward program starts.

end_at.description: Date at which the reward program ends. (Must be after the start_at)

budget_value.description: Value of the budget for the reward program. (Must be greater than 0)

budget_unit.description: Unit of the budget for the reard program.

duration_active.description: Number of days that a program can be active after it has been activated for a patient. (Must be greater than 0)

fulfill_as_earned.description: If true, the rewards created for a patient for the program can be fulfulled as they are earned. If false, the rewards should only be fulfilled when the program is deactivated.

frozen.description: If true, the reward program cannot be activated for a patient and new rewards cannot be created for the program.

items.description: Days of week that the action is scheduled for. Zero-indexed, ex 0 represents Sunday, etc.

completed_by.description: The coach who marked the calendar event as completed. Only valid for `plan-check-in` event type.

completed_at.description: The date and time when the calendar event is marked as completed. Only valid for `plan-check-in` event type.

type.description: The type of calendar event. Immutable after event creation.

time_zone.description: The time zone in which the dates for the calendar event are specified

all_day.description: True if the calendar event is an all day event, false otherwise. Must be set to true for `plan-check-in` event type. If it is true, then `start_at` and `end_at` must also be set to beginning of day, except `plan-check-in` event type does not need an `end_at` date. If it is false, then `start_at` and `end_at` must be on the same day.

start_at.description: The date and time when the calendar event starts

end_at.description: The date and time when the calendar event ends. Not valid for `plan-check-in` event type.

title.description: The title of the calendar event. Must not be empty or null

attendees.description: List of attendees for the calendar event

owner.description: The owner is the patient for whom the calendar event is created specificially for

included.description:
Related resources which are included in the response based on the `include` param.
Attributes of each resource will vary depending on the type.
See [patient](#operation/fetchPatient)

Related resources which are included in the response based on the `include` param.
Attributes of each resource will vary depending on the type.
See [patient](#operation/fetchPatient)

status_times.description: Status of email. Multiple statuses may be defined. The current status is the one with the most recent date.

spamreport.description: Time email was reported as spam.

stats.description: List of category, answered and total counts for questions in the health profile

items.description: The category, answered and total counts for questions in the health profile

included.description:
Related resources which are included in the response based on the `include` param.
Attributes of each resource will vary depending on the type.
See [patient](#operation/fetchPatient), [question](#operation/fetchHealthProfileQuestion)

Related resources which are included in the response based on the `include` param.
Attributes of each resource will vary depending on the type.
See [patient](#operation/fetchPatient), [question](#operation/fetchHealthProfileQuestion)

attributes.description: A health profile question does not have any attribute since it only relates an answer to the corresponding question definition.

included.description:
Related resources which are included in the response based on the `include` param.
Attributes of each resource will vary depending on the type.
See [question_definition](#operation/fetchHealthQuestionDefinition), [answer](#operation/fetchHealthProfileAnswer)

history.description: List of details of previous answers for a health profile question

items.description: The details of a previous answer for a health profile question

answered_at.description: The date when the health profile question is answered

value.description: The value of the answer entered for the health profile question

_created_by.description: The id of the patient or coach who answered the health profile question

latest.description: The details of the latest answer for a health profile question

answered_at.description: The date when the health profile question is answered

value.description: The value of the answer entered for the health profile question

_created_by.description: The id of the patient or coach who answered the health profile question

included.description:
Related resources which are included in the response based on the `include` param.
Attributes of each resource will vary depending on the type.
See [patient](#operation/fetchPatient)

Related resources which are included in the response based on the `include` param.
Attributes of each resource will vary depending on the type.
See [patient](#operation/fetchPatient)

category.description: The category for the health profile definition

format.description: The list of formats for the health profile definition

items.description: The label, value and icon for the answer choices for the question

requirements.description: The lsit of age and gender requirements for the question to be included

items.description: The age and gender requirement for the question to be included

shouldBeEqual.description: Specifies if the value in property should be equal to the one in value

shouldBeGreaterThan.description: Specifies if the value in property should be greater than the one in value

shouldBeLessThan.description: Specifies if the value in property should be less than the one in value

value.description: The value to be compared with the one in property, based on shouldBeEqual, shouldBeGreaterThan, or shouldBeLessThan

text.description: The question text which corresponds to the answer choices

id.description: Required if the `meta.query` is not defined.

meta.description: Allows the specification of a query for a patient rather than providing a patient id directly

query.description: The query must return one and only one patient.

allOf.description:
Note that `data` can either be a single object or an array of objects matching the schema specified here
(bulk create).

ignore_duplicates.description:
If `true`, the patient health metric will be ignored if there is an existing patient health metric for
the same patient, with the same `type` and same `occurred_at`.

unique.description: If `true`, the combination of system and value must be global unique among all patients and coaches in Twine.

notes.example: Patient called requesting opt out of coaching

note.example: Relies on daughter to get around
note.description: Coach's note about the patient. Not visible to the patient.

twine_web_app.description: A link to the patient record in the Twine web application.

allOf.description:
Note that `data` can either be a single object or an array of objects matching the schema specified here
(bulk create).

id.description: Required if the `meta.query` is not defined.

meta.description: Allows the specification of a query for a group rather than providing a group id directly

query.description:
1. If the query does not return any groups, a group with the specified name will be created and related to the patient.
2. If the query returns one group, that group will be related to the patient.
3. If the query returns more than one group, the creation of the patient will fail.

ignore_duplicates.description:
If `true`, patients with any conflicting identifiers (same `system` and `value`) will be ignored.
Useful for gracefully skipping duplicates after errors occur during bulk create.

included.description:
Related resources which are included in the response based on the `include` param.
Attributes of each resource will vary depending on the type.
See [action](#operation/fetchAction), [bundle](#operation/fetchBundle) and [patient](#operation/fetchPatient)

Related resources which are included in the response based on the `include` param.
Attributes of each resource will vary depending on the type.
See [action](#operation/fetchAction), [bundle](#operation/fetchBundle) and [patient](#operation/fetchPatient)

active.description: If true, the reward program is currently active.

activated_at.description: Date at which the reward program was activated for the patient. (Must be between the start_at and end_at dates for the reward program)

deactivated_at.description: Date at which the reward program was deactivated. (Must be after the activated_at date)

expires_at.description: Date at which the reward program activation expires. (Read-only property set by adding the days_active from the reward program to the activated_at date)

fulfill_as_earned.description: If true, the rewards created for a patient for the program can be fulfulled as they are earned. If false, the rewards should only be fulfilled when the program is deactivated. (Read-only property denormalized from the reward program)

total_allocated_value.description: Total value of reward allocated. (Read-only property)

total_earned_value.description: Total value of reward earnings. (Read-only property)

budget_unit.description: Unit of the reward program budget. (Read-only property)

_thread.description: Unique string identifying the health action with which the reward is associated.

allocated_value.description: Value of the reward program budget allocated for the reward. (Must not exceed the remaining budget for the reward program activation)

allocated_unit.description: Unit of the reward program. (Read-only property)

allocated_at.description: Date at which the reward was allocated. (Must be after the reward program is activated and before it is deactivated or expires)

target_at.description: Date at which the patient aspires to achieve the reward. (Must be the same or after the allocated_at date)

earned_value.description: Value of the reward that has been earned. (Read-only property)

earned_at.description: Date at which the reward was earned. (Read-only property)

fulfilled_value.description: Value of the earned reward that has been fulfilled. (Read-only property)

fulfilled_at.description: Date at which the reward earning was fulfilled. (Read-only property)

earned_value.description: Value of the reward that has been earned. (Must not exceed the allocated value for the reward)

earned_unit.description: Unit of the reward that has been earned. (Read-only property)

earned_at.description: Date at which the reward was earned. (Must be after the reward was allocated and before the reward program activation was deactivated or expired)

ready_for_fulfillment.description: If true, the reward earning is ready to be fulfilled, either because the reward program activation was fulfill_as_earned or because the reward program activation has been deactivated. (Read-only property)

fulfilled_value.description: Value of the earned reward that has been fulfilled. (Read-only property)

fulfilled_at.description: Date at which the reward earning was fulfilled. (Read-only property)

fulfilled_value.description: Value of the earned reward that has been fulfilled. (Must be greater than or equal to 0)

fulfilled_unit.description: Unit of the earned reward that has been fulfilled. (Read-only property)

fulfilled_at.description: Date at which the reward earning was fulfilled. (Must be at the same time or after the reward was earned)
